intro: Cybianthus lawrencei, commonly known as the Lawrence's cybianthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping it retain moisture in harsh environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
